citeinfo.origin: Rud. Virchow and Fr. v. Holtzenforff
citeinfo.title: The Deep Sea and Its Ground and Temperature Conditions

abstract.p: Publication Title: "Sammlung Gemein Verstandlicher Wisseuschaftlicher Vortrage" (Collection of Scientific Lectures). Volume XIII No. 289-312, pages 821-884.
Lecture title: "Die Tiefsee und Ihre Boden- und Temperatur- Verhaltnisse" ("The Deep-Sea and Its Ground and Temperature Conditions"). Author: Boguslawski, G. Von. Text in German.

Information in this collection dates back to the 18th century for daily, monthly, seasonal, and annual tabular summaries, and the 19th century for weather maps. In these summaries, definitions are:
1. Hourly/daily/monthly/seasonal/annual data -- values determined for each consecutive period, e.g. monthly temperature data: Jan 1900, Feb 1900, etc.
2. Long-term data -- values determined over a period of years, e.g. long-term monthly temperature data using Jan 1901, Jan 1902, etc.

This book contains tables of hourly sea surface and subsurface temperature recorded at 3 ships during voyages round the world in Pacific, Atlantic, and Indian Oceans, from 1873 through 1876. Also contains conditions of the sea floor ocean circulation and temperature distribution. Graphs contain the following data: - hourly sea surface and subsurface temperature Maps contain the following data: - depths of Pacific, Atlantic, and Indian Oceans.

descript.purpose: This book is a part of the foreign meteorological data collection held by the NOAA Central Library in Washington, DC.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
